title: Gunmaker American Outdoor Brands halted, company says sales fell 32.6% year over year
text:
CNBC.com Getty Images An attendee tries out an M&P 15-22 Sport rifle at the Smith & Wesson booth at the 2016 National Shooting Sports Foundation's Shooting, Hunting, Outdoor Trade (SHOT) Show at the Sands Expo and Convention Center on January 19, 2016 in Las Vegas, Nevada. 
American Outdoor Brands said Thursday that its sales fell 32.6 percent year over year in its fiscal third quarter. 
Formerly Smith & Wesson, the company said its results reflect a "continuation of challenging market conditions in the consumer market for firearms." 
The company also gave disappointing fourth-quarter guidance. 
The stock was halted at about 4 p.m. ET prior to the announcement. It is set to resume trading at 4:35 p.m. ET. 
This story is developing. Please check back for updates.
